message: Introducing ASP.Net vNext - the next generation of .NET on the Server
caption: Attachment UnavailableThis attachment may have been removed or the person who shared it may not have permission to share it with you.

data.message:
Kindly read the pinned post and update your post accordingly.
I'll give this post an hour before I nuke it.

Good luck.

Hady Ahmed: 
مع كامل إحترامي, ال pinned post
 بتاعة Amr Eldib
 إقتراح حلو وياريت اننا نعمل كدا, لكن أظن أسلوب انك  هتمسح اللى ميمشيش على الإقتراح دا مش صح.

That's understandable and certainly no one likes deleting anything in this group although some things just beg to be deleted.

However, if the active members like Amr Ali Tealeb and many others whose contributions are very much valued, don't share their insights. 

Then we don't expect that other less active members would be inclined to follow along the same path. Which poses a problem.
The problem is in the consistent decline of post quality, this isn't a link sharing group, neither is it a place to post questions you can easily find their answers on Google if someone indeed invested the time to do so.

We set a high standard, I and many others do our very best to uphold it and expect others to do so. That way, everyone rises to the same bar. Those who can't, but show interest in improving, are helped.

The group is there for people of knowledge, to interact with those seeking knowledge. Knowledge on a personal level, a level you otherwise won't get from a link on HN/Reddit or an answer on Stack overflow.

If a post is outside what's deemed acceptable, it's given a proper buffer before being canned.
I like the link, it's informative but if I apply that rule to X post, I will apply it to Z post. It's only fair.

Nothing gets deleted without a fair warning and nothing gets slammed down without constructive feedback.

The hope is, that people would interact. That's the whole purpose of the group.

Now Amr Ali Tealeb was kind enough to edit the post with a more informative message. 

Now if someone does a lot of backend development and isn't particularly familiar with the innards of .NET.
Reading "the next generation of .NET on the Server" would certainly know what this is all about and might get interested or ask a question about the current state of affairs in .NET, people's experiences and expectations...etc.

Hady Ahmed: I totally agree on the concept especially on being a role model for other parties in the group.
what I was insisting on is that explicitly pointing out that unless the post  has the proper description, I will delete it within 1 hour was not that good.
I hope you got my point in a good way, as I got yours :)
This is a duplicate, which is a good reason to delete, however deleting for not having a good description makes no sense to me at all.

If you think it's not clear (although the title of the link share says enough: ASP.NET vNext from Scott Hanselman), just write a description in the comment and ask the poster to edit the post, anything more isuseless and doesn't help much more than asking to edit, unless you want memebers to be "afraid" of deleting their posts, I don't think we want those members anyway.

Whether the title says enough or not is debatable, especially for anyone with little to do with .NET.
Nonetheless, I don't disagree with both of you. I've indeed handled this poorly and I extend my apologies.

Thanks to all participating in the discussion. 
Everyone has the interest of this community at heart, we're just looking at this from different sides.
There are no strict rules about this. It's a suggestion to make posts more helpful to people and invite discussion. 
There's not going to be deletion of posts because they don't have a description. There's no strict rule about that.
